TermsandConditionsContent:
Transfer of Shares
The Transferor transfers {number} of the shares to the Transferee in consideration of the amount 'Specified in the Transfer Price'. The transfer is absolute and includes all the rights to capital, voting rights, and dividends of the shares. The Transferor will transfer the shares to the Transferee on the effective date {date}.

Agreed Transfer Share Price
The shares price will be agreed upon and shall be transferred on the purchased price {price} as agreed by the transferor and transferee.

Consideration
In consideration of an amount of {usd} received by transferor. The transferor will transfer the {number} shares to the transferee.

Cost of Transfer
Any cost incurred during the transfer of shares shall be borne by the Transferor.

Warranty and Indemnity
It is agreed that the Transferor is the true and lawful owner of the shares and is entitled to all the benefits. There are no charges or obligations over the shares. The Transferor has the authority to transfer the shares and enter into the Agreement.

Embargo
Upon receiving the transfer shares, Transferee will be Embargo for 12 months or stated date set by the transferor from any sale of the transfer shares.

Share Redemption
If the shares are within their embargo period, both the Transferor and Transferee have the option to exercise share redemption if either party decides to withdraw from the agreement. In the event of redemption, the price of the redeemed shares will be determined by the purchase price with a maximum capital appreciation of 2% per week, based on the period that the Transferee held the shares.

Shares Allocation
Upon the date of the share embargo lifted, 20% of the agreed embargo shares will be allow to transact on the exchange. The balance 80% shares will be release accordingly to schedule. Remaining shares will be release on the 1st day of every subsequent month in batches of 20% on the agreed shares amount. 
The transferor will also activate the release of additional 20% of the shares unit at any one time when the Share Price increases to a value of more than 20% off the opening share price. Upon every subsequent additional 20% of the shares price increment, another further 20% of the shares unit will be release to the Transferee.
{shareTable}

Full Shares Allocation
Once 100% full shares is released by the transferor, the transferor will cease its obligation and responsibility towards the transferee. The transferee will renounce all contractual rights towards the transferor.
PageGcrSharesPurchaseAgreement.AllParties: IN WITNESS THEREOF, all parties hereto have executed this Agreement as on the day and year mentioned above.
PageGcrSharesPurchaseAgreement.ShareTransferAgreement:
This Share Purchase Agreement (hereinafter referred to as the âAgreementâ) is entered and shall be effective as on {effectiveDate},

By and Between

Genesis Capital Resources Ltd (hereinafter referred to as the âTransferorâ), having its registered place of business at 25 First Ave, SW STE A Watertown SD 57201, and;

{memberName}  (hereinafter referred to as the âTransfereeâ)

The Transferor and the Transferee are collectively referred to as the 'Parties' and 'Party' individually.

WHEREAS, the Transferor is the registered proprietor of shares and is desirous of transferring the shares to the Transferee

AND WHEREAS, the Transferee has agreed to acquire the shares from the Transferor

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration with the mutual covenants and promises made by the Parties hereby agree as follows:
MiscellaneousList: Severability: In the event, any provision of this Agreement is deemed to be invalid or unenforceable, in whole or part, that part shall be severed from the remainder of this Agreement, and all other provisions shall remain in full force and effect as valid and enforceable.
Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and in accordance with the laws of South Dakota, USA.

Variation: This Share Purchase Agreement shall be varied and any such variation shall be made in writing by both the Parties. The Transferor hereby agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Transferee against any damages arising out of this Agreement.
Notices: Any notices required or permitted by this Agreement shall be in writing and delivered by certified mail or courier to the mentioned address.
Entire Agreement: This is the entire Agreement regarding the terms and conditions of the Companyâs engagement. It supersedes all other agreements between the Parties whether oral or written.
PageGcrSharesPurchaseAgreement.SharetobeReleasedBaseonList: Share to be released base on 1st day of month (20%)
PageGcrSharesPurchaseAgreement.SharetobeReleasedBaseonPercent: Share to be released base on 20% Share Price increase (20%)

Ensure the network to receive withdrawal fund belongs to TRC20 USDT. Any other network will inevitably result in loss of funds.

Minimum withdrawal amount : 50 USDT. All withdrawals are subjected to 3% admin fee and network fee of 1 USDT.

The processing time for daily withdrawal request is between 0900H to 2200H (GMT+8). Request received after 2200H will be processed the following day.

PageAboutUs.AboutUsContent: We specialize in achieving capital growth through crude oil trading, crude oil production and refining, renewable energy research and development, carbon credit sales, and new energy real estate development.
PageAboutUs.GenesisCapitalResources: Genesis Capital Resources prides itself on having a stellar leadership team. Our team comprises executives with decades of experience and hailing from the energy or related industries. Together, these forward-looking individuals are driving Genesisâs transformation into a green company.
PageAboutUs.RhysWarrenDetail: Rhys Wyndam Warren is the founding director and CEO of Genesis Capital Resources Ltd. He has previously served a renowned role in JP Morgan and Burton Consulting Group, responsible for executing financial planning operations and corporate banking Services. Currently, He holds a degree from Stanford University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
PageAboutUs.PhilipCollinsPosition:
Head of Sales (Asia Pacific)
Genesis Capital Resources Ltd
PageAboutUs.OilBusinessBanner1Content1: Oil extraction and refining form the core business of Genesis Capital Resources today. Taken together with oil futures trading, the oil-related businesses account for more than 60% of the groupâs revenue. Our oil business is segmented into several distinct business units.
PageAboutUs.OilBusinessBanner1Content2:
Oil Extraction
Genesis Capital Resources possesses a large facility in Montney, British Columbia, Western Canada. This site boasts in excess of 6,820 horizontal locations and confirmed reserves are estimated at 2,501 million barrels of oil equivalent (MMboe). Our production capacity is nearly 225,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day (BOE/D).

Oil Refining and Blending
Oil refining and blending are important businesses in Genesis Capital Resourcesâ portfolio of business. Depending on the needs of our customers, we are also able to blend the individual components into compounds like RON 95 or RON 98. Our crude oil processing facility is capable of processing 5.5 million tonnes of crude oil per year.

Oil Products Transportation
Genesis Capital Resourcesâ facilities boast a huge number of storage tanks. These tanks are capable of storing our customersâ oil products till they are ready to be shipped out. These storage tanks are seamlessly connected to various transportation modes like bulk tankers, rail, ISO tank containers, and Flexi bags.
PageAboutUs.OurVisionContent2:
We aim to reduce our GHGÂ emissionsÂ drasticallyÂ byÂ 2030, and we will continue to promote green energy with our partners.Â Genesis Capital Resources has adopted an approach inspired by lifecycle analysis as the most suitable and representative for tracing the process toward carbon neutrality. Account of GHG emissions from our value chains refers to a distinctive proprietary methodology that allows us to obtain an integrated view of GHG emissions related to all green energy sold by Genesis Capital Resources.

The world is now sitting on a pivotal moment in history. Mankind needs to act if we are to secure Planet Earthâs future. We cannot push the problem down the road. The time to act is now.
PageAboutUs.OurVisionContent1: Genesis Capital Resources is taking proactive steps toward moving to a greener future. Through various initiatives, we areÂ actively promoting green energy. We are developing technologies that will benefit the communities around us and the ecosystem we all belong to. We are pioneering the path toward a more sustainable future.
PageAboutUs.OurPurposeContent2:
At the same time, we aim to build an inclusive company. Regardless of gender, race, belief, or any inclination, we welcome all who wish to contribute their skills to our company which, in turn, serves the communities it operates.  We want to make Genesis Capital Resources an attractive place to work and grow. We want people who want to contribute to the greater good.

At Genesis Capital Resources, we believe that our company, the communities, and Planet Earth are all important entities in a common ecosystem. We want to build a system of harmonious relationships so that the actions happening in the ecosystem becomes a virtuous cycle. No single effort is too small and every positive move results in a bigger positive move.

With a common goal and concerted efforts, we can make things happen.
PageAboutUs.OurPurposeContent1: Genesis Capital Resources exists for the purpose of making energy accessible to all. Whether one is a big city dweller, a suburb person, or a villager, one should be entitled to unfettered access to dependable and reliable sources of energy. We aim to bring energy to all individuals in a safe, affordable and sustainable manner.
PageAboutUs.KyleMcgaffeyDetail:
McGaffey brings to Genesis Capital Resources two decades of financial services sales experience, including selling investment products and technology solutions.
Most recently, he was head of sales at Thomson Reuters where he manage quantitative solutions to hedge funds, assets managers, and Global Banks.
He holds a degree in Economics from the University of St.Gallen and a CEMS master's degree in International Management.
PageAboutUs.BusinessModelContent1: As an integrated group of companies, Genesis Capital Resources is engaged in a wide range of related, yet diversified, businesses. It is firmly anchored in the energy industry, with interests in oil extraction, refining and blending, oil futures trading, renewable energy research and development, carbon extraction, carbon offset trading, and other renewable energy initiatives.
PageAboutUs.BusinessModelContent2:
Energy is a strategic asset of any country and there are inevitably interests in energy from various directions. Genesis Capital Resources has identified the opportunities presented by challenges surrounding energy. By applying its expertise and investing in resources in various aspects of the energy value chain, the company has firmly entrenched itself in the energy sector.

Looking forward, the company aims to be listed on NASDAQ, the secondary board of the New York Stock Exchange, in 2024. Not only will the expected capital injection bring the company to the next level and expand into new areas of growth, but having new members on the Board and leadership team will bring fresh perspectives and renewed vigor to the company.
PageAboutUs.OurHistoryBanner1Content1: Genesis Capital Resources was established in 2017. Its Founders witnessed the multiple oil crises in the 20th century and saw the opportunity to provide a dependable and reliable source of energy. The company started its history engaging in upstream aspects of the oil industry, namely oil production, refining and blending, and supplying to downstream customers.
PageAboutUs.OurHistoryBanner1Content2:
Apart from physical oil production and related activities, Genesis Capital Resources also participates in oil trading in the capital markets. This activity proved to be a lucrative source of profits and helped propel the company forward in the industry. Today, Genesis Capital Resources possesses multiple licenses in various jurisdictions. It holds the US {SecLicense}, the {NfaLicense}, and the {AsicLicens}. Consequently, it is regulated by financial institutions in the United States, Seychelles, the United Kingdom, and Australia. 

As the world started its move towards green energy in the early 21st century, Genesis Capital Resources took up a leadership role. It invested significant resources into renewable energy research and development, with the view towards improving such technologies and contributing to the wider society. Concurrently, it takes part in carbon emission trading as it helps to balance the emissions on a regional scale.  In line with these initiatives, the company has also embarked on carbon-neutral enterprise development, as well as green energy real estate development. 

As Genesis Capital Resources looks back at itsÂ fiveÂ years of history, it takes in valuable learnings and lessons and looks towards a greener, sustainable future.Â The company aims to leave a legacy and make positive contributions to humankind.
PageAboutUs.PhilipCollinsDetail: Seasoned sales and marketing professional with more than 10 years of experience in the corporate banking and financial sales sector, specializing in oil derivatives and the oil futures market. He has worked with international financial institutions over the years, playing an instrumental role in improving sales and marketing expertise. He is responsible for overseeing the company group's sales portfolio. Philip holds an MBA in finance from Columbia University in New York.
PageAboutUs.KyleMcgaffeyPosition:
Head of Sales, US Region
Genesis Capital Resources Ltd
PageAboutUs.OilFuturesTradingContent1: Apart from processing and trading in physical oil products, Genesis Capital Resources trades oil futures in the capital markets. By placing our positions in various CFD (Contract for Difference) instruments, we are able to profit from speculative price movements.
PageAboutUs.OilFuturesTradingContent2: Our trading terminals have direct and instantaneous connections with liquidity providers and our in-house traders possess years of experience trading in the oil futures market. We mainly trade the West Texas Intermediate (WTI or USOIL) and Brent Crude (BRENT or UKOIL) futures. Armed with our expert knowledge in technical analysis and sound money management rules, we are able to take a disciplined approach to oil futures trading.
PageAboutUs.RhysWarrenPosition:
Founding Director & CEO
Genesis Capital Resources Ltd
PageAboutUs.JeffersonMatthewDetail: With more than 8 years of experience in oil trading and the financial sector, he joined Genesis Capital Resources Ltd in 2019. He is instrumental in improving company investment and trading expertise as well as managing company market risk exposure. He holds a BSc (Hon) in Finance and Statistics from the University of Texas at Austin.

PageSignUpTerm.TrademarksContent: Genesis Capital Resources Ltd is the owner of several common law (or where indicated), registered trade marks which appear on the Site. Unauthorised use of these trademarks will infringe  intellectual property rights. If a User has infringed Genesis Capital Resources Ltdâs rights in this regard Genesis Capital Resources Ltd reserves its right to take action against the User.
PageSignUpTerm.TermsofUseContent:
As consideration for allowing an individual (User) to view the Content on this Site, Users agree to the following terms and conditions of use (Website Terms and Conditions).

Genesis Capital Resources Ltd provides Users with access to the Content and Facilities on this Site pursuant to a non-exclusive, worldwide, non-transferable license contained in these Websiteâs Terms and Conditions.

By viewing the Content, and using the Facilities on the Site, Users acknowledge and agree that they have had sufficient opportunity to read and understand these Website Terms and Conditions and that they are legally able to agree to be bound by them. If the User does not agree to these Website Terms and Conditions, please leave this Site immediately.

Any changes to these Website Terms and Conditions will appear on our Site or otherwise be brought to your attention.
PageSignUpTerm.LinkstoThirdPartySitesContent:
Genesis Capital Resources Ltd do not represent that the Content on other websites to which this Site contains links to, does not inadvertently infringe the intellectual property rights of any person anywhere in the world.

By inadvertently linking to infringing third-party content, Genesis Capital Resources Ltd is not authorizing the infringement of any intellectual property rights contained on those websites. Please contact us at {linkEmail}  to notify us of any links you allege are infringements.
PageSignUpTerm.PermittedUse: Permitted Use of Content and Facilities
PageSignUpTerm.DefinitionsContent:
Content means the written material, documents, graphics, and all the works shown in physical form on the Site including without limitation all text, alt tags, feedback, graphics, photographs, trademarks, logos, sound, music, artwork, and computer code.

Facilities mean any feature that appears on the Site for Users to use that is not Content.
PageSignUpTerm.PermittedUseContent:
Unless otherwise indicated, Genesis Capital Resources Ltd reserves all copyright in the Content and design of the Site. Genesis Capital Resources Ltd owns all such copyright and provide it to Users it under the terms of a limited licence embodied in these Terms and Conditions each time Users visit the Site.

Users may download, print or copy Content provided on the Site for their own use. Unless provided with a mechanism to do so, Users must not sell, lease, furnish or otherwise permit or cause others to provide access to the Site.

Users must not use, reproduce, communicate, publish, or distribute any of the Content on this Site, unless this constitutes a fair dealing for the purposes of the Copyright Act 1968 (Cth) (Act). In particular, Users must not reproduce or use any of the information on our Site for commercial benefit.

Other than for the purposes of and subject to the conditions prescribed under the Act as otherwise provided for in these Terms and Conditions, no part of the Content may in any form or by any means (including framing, screen scraping, electronic, mechanical, microcopying, photocopying or recording) be reproduced, adapted, stored in a retrieval system or transmitted without prior written permission.
PageSignUpTerm.LimitationofLiabilityContent:
Users access the Site at their own risk and are responsible for compliance with the laws of their jurisdiction in addition to these Terms and Conditions.

Genesis Capital Resources Ltd makes the Site available for Users to use, however it does not assume a duty of care to Users. Genesis Capital Resources Ltd makes no representation and provide no warranty regarding the quality, accuracy, completeness, merchantability, or fitness for purpose of the Content on the Site.

If relying on the Content, Users must make their own investigations to ensure its accuracy before relying on the Content.

No warranty or representation that the Genesis Capital Resources Ltd Site and the Content will not cause damage or are free from any computer virus or any other defects or errors is made.

Where any law implies a warranty into these Terms and Conditions, which may not lawfully be excluded, then to the maximum extent permitted by law, Genesis Capital Resources Ltdâs liability for breach of the warranty will at the option of Genesis Capital Resources Ltd be limited to the supply of the product or services again, or the payment of the cost of having them supplied again.

Where liability cannot be excluded, any liability incurred in relation to the use of the Site or the Content is limited as provided under the Competition and Consumer Act 2010 (Cth).

Under no circumstances will Genesis Capital Resources Ltd be liable for any incidental, special, or consequential damages, including damages for loss of business or other profits arising in relation to the use or reliance on Content on the Site.
ProhibitionsContent: Data mine or conduct automated searches on this Site or the Content on this Site, whether through the use of additional software or otherwise;
Tamper with, hinder the operation of, or make unauthorized modifications to the Site or any of its Content;
Transmit any virus, worm or other disabling feature to or via this Site;
Abuse, defame, harass, stalk, threaten or otherwise violate Genesis Capital Resources Ltd legal rights;
Advertise or offer to sell any goods or services, or conduct or forward surveys, contests, or chain letters from this Site or the domain; and
Delete any author attributions, legal notices or proprietary designations or labels in any file that is uploaded by a User.
PageSignUpTerm.ProvisionofServiceContent:
Genesis Capital Resources Ltd may without notice suspend access to the Site or disconnect or deny Users access to any part of the Site during any technical failure or maintenance period.

Genesis Capital Resources Ltd may also choose at Genesis Capital Resources Ltdâs sole discretion to block or deny any particular User with access to any of the Content or Facilities contained on the Site.

Genesis Capital Resources Ltd may make improvements and or changes to the Site and the Content at any time without notice. Genesis Capital Resources Ltd does not warrant that the information architecture or navigation will not change now or at any time in the future.
PageSignUpTerm.PrivacyPolicyContent: In using the Website, Users are deemed to also accept the terms and conditions of Genesis Capital Resources Ltdâs Privacy Policy.

PagePromotionMacau.TermsAndConditionsContent:
1. During the event period (between February 8 and 15, 2023), all members can apply for the [Light Up the World Â· Macau China] event to receive "Genesis Commemorative Gold Coin".

â¨2. Members need to purchase a total value of 10,000 USDT to receive âGenesis Commemorative gold coinâ. The 10,000 USDT amount can be used to purchase GCR issued shares only after the full 10,000USDT payment is completed.â¨

3. If the member chooses to pay a deposit first (min. 2000USDT), he needs to complete the balance payment in the system before 23:59 on February 15. If the member fails to complete the final payment before the specified time, the paid deposit will be regarded as the purchase price of commemorative gold coins.

4. All those who apply for the [Light up the World Â· Macau China] promotion to receive "Genesis Commemorative Gold Coins" will be able to submit their receiving address after 9th February 1700hrs.

GeneralDataProtectionRegulationContent: Genesis Capital Resources Ltd will comply with the principles of data protection set out in the GDPR for the purpose of fairness, transparency and lawful data collection and use.
We process your personal information as a Processor and/or to the extent that we are a Controller as defined in the GDPR.
We must establish a lawful basis for processing your personal information. The legal basis for which we collect your personal information depends on the data that we collect and how we use it.

We will only collect your personal information with your express consent for a specific purpose and any data collected will be to the extent necessary and not excessive for its purpose. We will keep your data safe and secure.
We will also process your personal information if it is necessary for our legitimate interests, or to fulfil a contractual or legal obligation.

We process your personal information if it is necessary to protect your life or in a medical situation, it is necessary to carry out a public function, a task of public interest or if the function has a clear basis in law.

We do not collect or process any personal information from you that is considered âSensitive Personal Informationâ under the GDPR, such as personal information relating to your sexual orientation or ethnic origin unless we have obtained your explicit consent, or if it is being collected subject to and in accordance with the GDPR.

You must not provide us with your personal information if you are under the age of 16 without the consent of your parent or someone who has parental authority for you. We do not knowingly collect or process the personal information of children.
HostingandInternationalContent: Information that we collect may from time to time be stored, processed in or transferred between parties or sites located in countries outside of United States of America. These may include, but are not limited to United States of America.

We and our other group companies have offices and/or facilities in United States of America. Transfers to each of these countries will be protected by appropriate safeguards, these include one or more of the following: the use of standard data protection clauses adopted or approved by the European Commission which you can obtain from the European Commission Website; the use of binding corporate rules, a copy of which you can obtain from Genesis Capital Resources Ltd Data Protection Officer.

The hosting facilities for our website are situated in United States of America. Transfers to each of these Countries will be protected by appropriate safeguards, these include one or more of the following: the use of standard data protection clauses adopted or approved by the European Commission which you can obtain from the European Commission Website; the use of binding corporate rules, a copy of which you can obtain from Genesis Capital Resources Ltd Data Protection Officer.

Our Suppliers and Contractors are situated in United States of America. Transfers to each of these Countries will be protected by appropriate safeguards, these include one or more of the following: the use of standard data protection clauses adopted or approved by the European Commission which you can obtain from the European Commission Website; the use of binding corporate rules, a copy of which you can obtain from Genesis Capital Resources Ltd Data Protection Officer.

You acknowledge that personal data that you submit for publication through our website or services may be available, via the internet, around the world. We cannot prevent the use (or misuse) of such personal data by others.
PagePrivacyPolicy.YourRightsSubContent:
Please contact us at any time to exercise your rights under the GDPR at the contact details in this Privacy Policy.

We may ask you to verify your identity before acting on any of your requests.
SecurityYourPersonalInformationContent: Genesis Capital Resources Ltd is committed to ensuring that the information you provide to us is secure. In order to prevent unauthorised access or disclosure, we have put in place suitable physical, electronic and managerial procedures to safeguard and secure information and protect it from misuse, interference, loss and unauthorised access, modification and disclosure.

Where we employ data processors to process personal information on our behalf, we only do so on the basis that such data processors comply with the requirements under the GDPR and that have adequate technical measures in place to protect personal information against unauthorised use, loss and theft.

The transmission and exchange of information is carried out at your own risk. We cannot guarantee the security of any information that you transmit to us, or receive from us. Although we take measures to safeguard against unauthorised disclosures of information, we cannot assure you that personal information that we collect will not be disclosed in a manner that is inconsistent with this Privacy Policy.
PagePrivacyPolicy.YouWithholdYourPersonalInformation:
If you withhold your personal information, it may not be possible for us to provide you with our products and services or for you to fully access our website.

We may disclose your personal information to comply with a legal requirement, such as a law, regulation, court order, subpoena, warrant, legal proceedings or in response to a law enforcement agency request.

If there is a change of control in our business or a sale or transfer of business assets, we reserve the right to transfer to the extent permissible at law our user databases, together with any personal information and non-personal information contained in those databases.
PagePrivacyPolicy.HowWeCollect: How we collect your personal information
DisclosureContent: Genesis Capital Resources Ltd may disclose your personal information to any of our employees, officers, insurers, professional advisers, agents, suppliers or subcontractors insofar as reasonably necessary for the purposes set out in this privacy policy.
If we do disclose your personal information to a third party, we will protect it in accordance with this privacy policy.
WeRespectYourPrivacyContent: Genesis Capital Resources Ltd respects your right to privacy and is committed to safeguarding the privacy of our customers and website visitors. This policy sets out how we collect and treat your personal information.
We adhere to the United States of America Privacy Principles contained in the Privacy Act 1978 (Cth) and to the extent applicable, the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

âPersonal informationâ is the information we hold which is identifiable as being about you. This includes information such as your name, email address, identification number, or any other type of information that can reasonably identify an individual, either directly or indirectly.
You may contact us for further information about this Privacy Policy.
HowWeUseList: Provide you with products and services during the usual course of our business activities;
Manage, research and develop our products and services;
Provide you with information about our products and services;
Communicate with you by a variety of measures including, but not limited to, by telephone, email, sms or mail; and
PagePrivacyPolicy.YourRightsContent:
If you are an individual residing in the EU, you have certain rights as to how your personal information is obtained and used. Genesis Capital Resources Ltd complies with your rights under the GDPR as to how your personal information is used and controlled if you are an individual residing in the EU.

Except as otherwise provided in the GDPR, you have the following rights:
WhatPersonalInformationContent: Genesis Capital Resources Ltd will, from time to time, receive and store personal information you submit to our website, provided to us directly or given to us in other forms.
You may provide basic information such as your name, phone number, address and email address to enable us to send you information, provide updates and process your product or service order.

We may collect additional information at other times, including but not limited to, when you provide feedback, when you provide information about your personal or business affairs, change your content or email preference, respond to surveys and/or promotions, provide financial or credit card information, or communicate with our customer support.
Additionally, we may also collect any other information you provide while interacting with us.
PagePrivacyPolicy.GeneralDataProtectionRegulation: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) for the European Union (EU)
PagePrivacyPolicy.ChangesPrivacyPolicyContent: Please be aware that we may change this Privacy Policy in the future. We may modify this Policy at any time, in our sole discretion and all modifications will be effective immediately upon our posting of the modifications on our website or notice board. Please check back from time to time to review our Privacy Policy.
PagePrivacyPolicy.ComplaintsContent: If you have any complaints about our privacy practices, please feel free to send in details of your complaints to {linkEmail}. We take complaints very seriously and will respond shortly after receiving written notice of your complaint.
AccessYourPersonalInformationContent: You may request details of personal information that we hold about you in accordance with the provisions of the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth), and to the extent applicable the EU GDPR. If you would like a copy of the information which we hold about you or believe that any information we hold on you is inaccurate, out of date, incomplete, irrelevant or misleading, please email us at {linkEmail}
We reserve the right to refuse to provide you with information that we hold about you, in certain circumstances set out in the Privacy Act or any other applicable law.
HowWeCollectContent: Genesis Capital Resources Ltd collects personal information from you in a variety of ways, including when you interact with us electronically or in person, when you access our website and when we engage in business activities with you. We may receive personal information from third parties. If we do, we will protect it as set out in this Privacy Policy.
By providing us with personal information, you consent to the supply of that information subject to the terms of this Privacy Policy.
WebsiteContent: When you visit our website â When you come to our website, we may collect certain information such as browser type, operating system, website visited immediately before coming to our site, etc. This information is used in an aggregated manner to analyse how people use our site, such that we can improve our service.

Cookies â We may from time to time use cookies on our website. Cookies are very small files which a website uses to identify you when you come back to the site and to store details about your use of the site. Cookies are not malicious programs that access or damage your computer. Most web browsers automatically accept cookies but you can choose to reject cookies by changing your browser settings. However, this may prevent you from taking full advantage of our website. Our website may from time to time use cookies to analyses website traffic and help us provide a better website visitor experience. In addition, cookies may be used to serve relevant ads to website visitors through third party services such as Google AdWords. These ads may appear on this website or other websites you visit.

Third party sites â Our site may from time to time have links to other websites not owned or controlled by us. These links are meant for your convenience only. Links to third party websites do not constitute sponsorship or endorsement or approval of these websites. Please be aware that Genesis Capital Resources Ltd is not responsible for the privacy practises of other such websites. We encourage our users to be aware, when they leave our website, to read the privacy statements of each and every website that collects personal identifiable information.
PagePrivacyPolicy.Title: Privacy Policy
YourRightsList: To be informed how your personal information is being used;
Access your personal information (we will provide you with a free copy of it);
To correct your personal information if it is inaccurate or incomplete;
To delete your personal information (also known as âthe right to be forgottenâ);
To restrict processing of your personal information;
To retain and reuse your personal information for your own purposes;
To object to your personal information being used; and
To object against automated decision making and profiling.
PagePrivacyPolicy.HowWeUse: How we use your personal information
PagePrivacyPolicy.HowWeUseContent:
Genesis Capital Resources Ltd may use personal information collected from you to provide you with information about our products or services. We may also make you aware of new and additional products, services and opportunities available to you.

Genesis Capital Resources Ltd will use personal information only for the purposes that you consent to. This may include to:

PageClaimRewardTerm.Title:
(Individual investors) 
Genesis Capital Resources commemorative gold coin (Terms and conditions)
Content: The event period's deadline is January 19, 2023.

Investors can receive ãCommemorative Coinã through an accumulation of GCRÂ shares.Â  You can submit an application whenever your total investments reach 15,000 US dollars. TheÂ delivery tracking number will be sent to youÂ when the ãCommemorative Coinã is dispatched.
All applications must be submitted before 23:59 pm (GMT+8) on 19th February 2023
For every 15,000 USD, you may apply for a piece ofãCommemorative Coinã. Multiple applications are allowed.Â Â

If your total investment amount falls below $15,000 USD due to redemption application, Genesis Capital Resources will deduct the current value of the [commemorative coin] from your redemption amount.
Note :The value of the [Commemorative coins] is calculated as such : [ Current gold price x 10grams x 120%]
Genesis Capital Resources retains the right to modify any of the terms mentioned above.

PagePromotionGoldBarTerms.Title: Genesis Conv. GCR Station Terms & Conditions
PagePromotionGoldBarTerms.Content:
1. By participating in Genesis Convertible GCR Station, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and accepted all of the terms and conditions in these Terms, and you acknowledge and agree that you will be bound by and will comply with these Terms. If you do not understand and accept these Terms in their entirety, you should not participate.

 2. For each 5 gram Genesis Reserved Gold Piece,  you will need to deposit 2000 units of Convertible GCR for a period of 30 days.

 3. Members will still earn the respective daily dividend while their Convertible GCR is being staked.

 4. For request of early redemption, there will be a deposit of 350USD and 200 Convertible GCR. The penalty will be deducted from the GCR deposit accordingly.

 5.  Deposited Convertible GCR will be returned to your Convertible GCR account immediately after the end date.

 6.  Genesis Reserved Gold Piece will be subjected to availability, if the gold piece is unavailable, it may take up to 14 days to deliver due to reproduction.  

 7.  Genesis Capital Resources reserved the right to amend any part of the terms without any prior notice.

PageClaimGift.ModalMessage: You have been promoted to {level} Rank and fulfilled the âElite Agent Programmeâ requirements and won {reward}!

PagePromotionGoldBarTerms2nd.Title: Genesis Conv. GCR Station Terms & Conditions
PagePromotionGoldBarTerms2nd.Content:
1. Once you participate in Genesis Capital Resources  [Carbon Rights Trading Dividends], we will define that you have read, understood and accepted all the terms and conditions, and agree to abide by them. If you do not fully understand and accept these terms, please do not participate.

2.  When you deposit 100 GCR, you will receieve 12 USD from Genesis Capital Resources [Carbon Trading Dividend]. The duration for 30 days and can be applied for multiple times.
Example: After you participate in [Carbon Rights Trading Dividends] and deposit 1,000 GCR, you will receive 12USD x 10 = 120USD.

3.  When your GCR has been deposited, you can still receive the daily dividends generated by it.

4.  If you intend to redeem the GCR stored before the end date, 10 GCR and 12USD (the current GENESIS price deducts the corresponding number of GENESIS units) will be deducted as liquidated damages for every 100 GCR deposited. After deducting the GCR corresponding to the default amount, your remaining GCR will be transfer to your account immediately.

5. GCR deposited will be automatically transferred to your account after 30 days (according to the time when you start holding shares).

6.  Genesis Capital Resources reserves the right to modify all terms without prior notice.

ImportantNoticeMessages: Shareholders have to complete KYC verification to apply for physical share certificate.
An application fee of USD 100 will be charged when applying physical share certificate.
PageShareCertificate.Title: Share Certificate
PageShareCertificate.KycConfirmMessage: You have not verified your account.

PageGcrShareRedemptionTermsAndConditions.Description:
Genesis Capital Resources Ltd will buy back your related equities if you opt for shares redemption. The equivalent amount will also be subtracted from your account's GCR bonds and Convertible GCR. Your redemption amount will be calculated based on how long you have owned the GCR shares. Please contact online customer service if you have any queries about the redeemable amount before continuing.

All shares redemption applications will be reviewed and processed within 5â7 working days.

Please read the following details and conditions carefully before clicking the confirm button. The company won't be able to withdraw your redemption application after it has been submitted.
Content:
Before moving on, kindly read through the terms and conditions
a) You can receive 85% of the redeemed capital which does not include a 3% processing fee if the shares you ownedÂ are less than 21 days old.
b) If the shares are heldÂ for more than 21 days, you will receive 2% weekly dividends for the amount you choose to redeem.
The company's estimate serves as the basis for all calculations of redeemable capital. Please get in touch with our online customer support if you require any confirmation.

Exclusively for 1b): If you opt to apply for a partial share redemption, Genesis Capital Resources Ltd will calculate based on a percentage of the redemption amount. For example, if you choose to redeem 50% of yourÂ capital injected,Â 50% ofÂ your GCR convertibleÂ bonds, andÂ dividends you earnedÂ during the term will be deducted from your account. Any amount that you have withdrawn before the redemption will be subtracted from your redeemable capital in proportion to your redemption amount.
You won't be able to receive anyÂ dividends if you holdÂ less than 500 GCR shares.
If you have partaken in any rewards or promotion with Genesis Capital Resources, you must comply with its terms and conditions before you can complete the redemption application.
All capital redemption applications will be reviewed and processed within 5â7 working days.
You must return any stock certificates you have received from Genesis Capital Resources before your application for redemption will be approved.
The company has the right to reject your shares redemption application and seize all of your GCR assets if it determines that you violated the rules or acted unfairly during the period.
PageGcrShareRedemptionTermsAndConditions.Title: GCR shares Redemption Terms and Conditions
